verses.name: Philemon 1:1
verses.text: Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon our beloved fellow worker

verses.name: Philemon 1:2
verses.text: and Apphia our sister and Archippus our fellow soldier, and the church in your house:

verses.name: Philemon 1:3
verses.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:4
verses.text: I thank my God always when I remember you in my prayers,

verses.name: Philemon 1:5
verses.text: because I hear of your love and of the faith that you have toward the Lord Jesus and all the saints,

verses.name: Philemon 1:6
verses.text: and I pray that the sharing of your faith may become effective for the full knowledge of every good thing that is in us for the sake of Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:7
verses.text: For I have derived much joy and comfort from your love, my brother, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you.

verses.name: Philemon 1:8
verses.text: Accordingly, though I am bold enough in Christ to command you to do what is required,

verses.name: Philemon 1:9
verses.text: yet for love's sake I prefer to appeal to you- I, Paul, an old man and now a prisoner also for Christ Jesus-

verses.name: Philemon 1:10
verses.text: I appeal to you for my child, Onesimus, whose father I became in my imprisonment.

verses.name: Philemon 1:11
verses.text: (Formerly he was useless to you, but now he is indeed useful to you and to me.)

verses.name: Philemon 1:12
verses.text: I am sending him back to you, sending my very heart.

verses.name: Philemon 1:13
verses.text: I would have been glad to keep him with me, in order that he might serve me on your behalf during my imprisonment for the gospel,

verses.name: Philemon 1:14
verses.text: but I preferred to do nothing without your consent in order that your goodness might not be by compulsion but of your own free will.

verses.name: Philemon 1:15
verses.text: For this perhaps is why he was parted from you for a while, that you might have him back forever,

verses.name: Philemon 1:16
verses.text: no longer as a slave but more than a slave, as a beloved brother- especially to me, but how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

verses.name: Philemon 1:17
verses.text: So if you consider me your partner, receive him as you would receive me.

verses.name: Philemon 1:18
verses.text: If he has wronged you at all, or owes you anything, charge that to my account.

verses.name: Philemon 1:19
verses.text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will repay it- to say nothing of your owing me even your own self.

verses.name: Philemon 1:20
verses.text: Yes, brother, I want some benefit from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

verses.name: Philemon 1:21
verses.text: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I say.

verses.name: Philemon 1:22
verses.text: At the same time, prepare a guest room for me, for I am hoping that through your prayers I will be graciously given to you.

verses.name: Philemon 1:23
verses.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends greetings to you,

verses.name: Philemon 1:24
verses.text: and so do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

verses.name: Philemon 1:25
verses.text: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
